hearth.utils package

Submodules

forge.hearth.utils.bounds module

Functions to check if a point is within particular bounds.

forge.hearth.utils.bounds.point_within_circle(point: Vector2D, center: Vector2D, radius: int) → bool

Check if a point lies within the bounds of a circle.

Parameters

  • point (forge.core.physics.vector.Vector2D) – Point to check for bounds.

  • center (forge.core.physics.vector.Vector2D) – Center of the circle.

  • radius (int) – Radius of the circle.

Returns

True if the point lies within the bounds of the circle; else False.

Return type

bool

forge.hearth.utils.bounds.point_within_polygon(point: Vector2D, vertices: list[forge.core.physics.vector.Vector2D]) → bool

Check of a point lies within the bounds of a polygon.

Parameters

  • point (forge.core.physics.vector.Vector2D) – Point to check for bounds.

  • vertices (list[forge.core.physics.vector.Vector2D]) – List of vertices describing the polygon.

Returns

True if the point lies within the bounds of the polygon; else False.

Return type

bool

forge.hearth.utils.bounds.point_within_rectangle(point: Vector2D, top_left: Vector2D, width: int, height: int) → bool

Check if a point lies within the bounds of a rectangle.

Parameters

  • point (forge.core.physics.vector.Vector2D) – Point to check for bounds.

  • top_left (forge.core.physics.vector.Vector2D) – Top-left of the rectangle.

  • width (int) – Width of the rectangle.

  • height (int) – Height of the rectangle.

Returns

True if the point lies within the bounds of the rectangle; else False.

Return type

bool
